title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – On a night when the scoreboard told a story of victory, the history books will remember only one name: Hakeem Olajuwon. The Houston Rockets’ legendary center authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 52 points to single-handedly dismantle the Dallas Mavericks in a 112-102 triumph.

From the opening tip, this was The Dream’s personal showcase. He was simply unstoppable, a whirlwind of spinning drop-steps and feathery-soft turnaround jumpers that left the Mavericks’ defense grasping at air. Olajuwon’s 52 points weren't just a number; they were a relentless, quarter-by-quarter demolition of an entire game plan. He carried the Rockets’ offense on his back, his historic output ensuring his team never truly faltered.

While Olajuwon’s scoring was a force of nature, his all-around brilliance shone through. He complemented his offensive masterpiece with 18 rebounds, anchoring the paint at both ends of the floor. Clyde Drexler provided crucial support with 20 points, but on this night, he was a stellar sidekick to a main act that commanded every ounce of attention.

Dallas, led by 24 points from Jim Jackson, fought valiantly but had no answer for the onslaught. They were witnesses to a piece of NBA history, a player reaching a zenith that few ever approach. The final score signifies a Rockets win, but the real story was etched into the record books by one man. In a career filled with magical moments, Hakeem Olajuwon’s 52-point night stands as one of his most dominant and unforgettable masterpieces.
